example:
A: How did you find yourself in this mess?
B: Honestly, I have no idea.
A: You always attract drama.
B: It just follows me, I swear.
A: We need to fix this.
B: Please help me out.
japanese: 気（き）づいたら〜にいた。／〜という状況（じょうきょう）に陥（おちい）る。
chinese: 他这人真不靠谱 (Tā zhè rén zhēn bù kàopǔ) / 他老放人鸽子 (Tā lǎo fàng rén gēzi)

example:
A: Did you read the report?
B: I just skimmed through it.
A: You need to know the details.
B: I'll read it properly later.
A: The meeting is in 10 minutes.
B: Okay, okay, reading now.
japanese: ざっと目（め）を通（とお）す。／斜（なな）め読（よ）みする。
chinese: 我正顺着呢 (Wǒ zhèng shùnzhe ne) / 势不可挡 (Shì bùkě dǎng)

example:
A: They cancelled our flight, and there are no more today.
B: If we have to stay another night, then so be it .
A: It’s so frustrating to lose a whole day like this.
B: That’s the way it is with winter travel .
A: I guess that’s how it goes sometimes.
B: Exactly, it is what it is, let’s find a hotel.
japanese: それならそれで。／しょうがない。
chinese: 这还用问吗 (Zhè hái yòng wèn ma) / 显而易见的事 (Xiǎn'éryìjiàn de shì)

example:
A: Look at those two.
B: They are made for each other.
A: They even dress alike.
B: It's sickeningly cute.
A: I give it six months.
B: Don't be such a hater.
japanese: お似合（にあ）いだ。／割（わ）れ鍋（なべ）に綴（と）じ蓋（ぶた）。
chinese: 无附加条件 (Wú fùjiā tiáojiàn) / 不求回报 (Bù qiú huíbào)

similar: A good start is half the battle.
Getting started is the hardest part.
example:
A: I finally signed up for the gym.
B: Nice! Well begun is half done.
A: Now I actually have to go.
B: You got this. Just show up.
A: Tomorrow morning, 6 AM.
B: I'll believe it when I see it.
japanese: 始（はじ）めが肝心（かんじん）。／着手（ちゃくしゅ）すれば半分（はんぶん）終（お）わったようなもの。
chinese: 有消息随时通知我 (Yǒu xiāoxi suíshí tōngzhī wǒ) / 别把我耽误了 (Bié bǎ wǒ dānwù le)

example:
A: Why is he bringing coffee for the boss?
B: He's trying to butter him up for a raise.
A: That's so obvious.
B: Gotta play the game, I guess.
A: I refuse to stoop that low.
B: Enjoy staying at your current salary.
japanese: ご機嫌（きげん）をとる。／おめでたを言（い）う。
chinese: 别担心 (Bié dānxīn) / 没什么大不了的 (Méi shénme dàbùliǎo de)

example:
A: This burger looks nothing like the picture.
B: You were taken in by the ad.
A: It looked so huge on TV.
B: Rookie mistake.
A: I want a refund.
B: Good luck with that.
japanese: 広告（こうこく）に騙（だま）された。／釣（つ）られた。
chinese: 我累坏了 (Wǒ lèi huài le) / 精疲力竭 (Jīngpílìjié)

example:
A: By any chance, did you see my phone?
B: I think you left it in the car.
A: Oh, thank god.
B: You'd lose your head if it wasn't attached.
A: Too true.
B: Go check the passenger seat.
japanese: ひょっとして。／もしかして。
chinese: 真便宜 (Zhēn piányi) / 简直像捡来的一样 (Jiǎnjié xiàng jiǎn lái de yīyàng)

meaning: 비위가 약해. 소화가 잘 안 돼.
example:
A: Want to try these fried bugs?
B: No way. I have a weak stomach.
A: Come on, it's protein.
B: I will literally vomit on you.
A: Okay, okay, never mind.
B: Keep that away from me.
japanese: 胃腸（いちょう）が弱（よわ）くて。／すぐ気持（きも）ち悪（わる）くなる。
chinese: 冷静点 (Lěngjìng diǎn) / 控制好自己 (Kòngzhì hǎo zìjǐ)

example:
A: It tastes awful.
B: Just down it. It'll make you feel better.
A: Here goes nothing.
B: There you go! Champ.
A: Ugh, never again.
B: Give it five minutes.
japanese: イッキして！／飲（の）み干（ほ）して！
chinese: 算我一个 (Suàn wǒ yīgè) / 我也参加 (Wǒ yě cānjiā)

meaning: 약 올리지 마. (아픈 데 찌르지 마)
similar: Don't kick me when I'm down.
example:
A: 5-0? I crushed you!
B: Okay, don't rub it in.
A: Best game of my life.
B: You got lucky.
A: Scoreboard says otherwise.
B: Rematch. Right now.
japanese: 追（お）い討（う）ちをかけないで。／調子（ちょうし）に乗（の）るな。
chinese: 别绕弯子 (Bié ràowānzi) / 开门见山吧 (Kāiménjiànshān ba)

similar: He's got a thing for you.
example:
A: Why is he always texting me?
B: Duh, he has feelings for you.
A: You think?
B: It's painfully obvious.
A: I thought we were just friends.
B: Not from his side.
japanese: 彼（かれ）、気（き）があるよ。／絶対（ぜったい）好（す）きだって。
chinese: 我挺你 (Wǒ tǐng nǐ) / 有我撑着你 (Yǒu wǒ chēngzhe nǐ)

example:
A: Did you really send him money?
B: He said it was an emergency!
A: You always fall for these scams.
B: But he seemed so genuine.
A: Blocking his number now.
B: Okay fine.
japanese: 騙（だま）される。／落（お）ちる（恋（こい）におちる）。
chinese: 祝你演出成功 (Zhù nǐ yǎnchū chénggōng) / 好运 (Hǎoyùn)

example:
A: Do you think the weather will hold for the rooftop party?
B: It’s looking a bit iffy according to the forecast.
A: The whole plan is up in the air then?
B: Yeah, it's definitely dicey with those clouds.
A: Should we move it indoors just in case?
B: It’s touch and go, but a backup plan is smart.
japanese: 微妙（びみょう）だ。／怪（あや）しい。
chinese: 小菜一碟 (Xiǎocài yī dié) / 易如反掌 (Yìrúfǎnzhǎng)

example:
A: What are you hiding behind your back?
B: Behold! The world's best sandwich.
A: You made that?
B: With my own two hands.
A: It does look amazing.
B: Prepare your tastebuds.
japanese: 見（み）よ！／じゃじゃーん！
chinese: 今天就到这儿吧 (Jīntiān jiù dào zhèr ba) / 收工 (Shōugōng)

example:
A: Mom, guess what?
B: What?
A: I made the Dean's list again.
B: I'm so proud of you! We need to celebrate.
A: Sushi tonight?
B: Anything you want.
japanese: 成绩優秀者（せいせきゆうしゅうしゃ）リスト。／優等生（ゆうとうせい）。
chinese: 拐弯抹角 (Guǎiwānmòjiǎo) / 绕圈子 (Rào quānzi)

primary: Don't try to pull a fast one
meaning: 속일 생각 하지 마. 수작 부리지 마.
example:
A: I forgot my wallet, I'll pay you tomorrow.
B: Don't try to pull a fast one with me.
A: I'm serious!
B: Venmo me right now.
A: Fine.
B: Thought so.
japanese: 騙（だま）そうとしても無駄（むだ）だよ。／ペテンにかかるかよ。
chinese: 贪多嚼不烂 (Tānduōjiáobùlàn) / 自不量力 (Zìbùliànglì)

example:
A: Why is there plastic wrap on the toilet?
B: Haha, you got pranked!
A: You are so immature.
B: You should have seen your face.
A: Clean this up. Now.
B: Worth it.
japanese: ドッキリに引（ひ）っかかった。／騙（だま）されたー。
chinese: 电视迷 (Diànshìmí) / 懒虫 (Lǎnchóng)

example:
A: We're gonna be late for the movie.
B: Traffic is terrible.
A: Just step on it when the light turns green.
B: I'm not getting a ticket for 'Dune'.
A: Please?
B: We'll get there when we get there.
japanese: 急（いそ）いで！／スピード上（あ）げて！
chinese: 慢慢来 (Mànman lái) / 小心点儿 (Xiǎoxīn diǎnr)

example:
A: She's only 20 and he's 80.
B: Classic gold digger situation.
A: Maybe it's true love?
B: Yeah, love for his bank account.
A: Cynic.
B: Realist.
japanese: 金（かね）目当（めあ）て。／遺産（いさん）狙（ねら）い。
chinese: 临场脱逃 (Línchǎng tuōtáo) / 胆怯了 (Dǎnqiè le)

example:
A: I'm going to start a business next month.
B: You said that last year. You're all talk.
A: This time is different.
B: Show me, don't tell me.
A: Watch me succeed.
B: I'm waiting.
japanese: 口（くち）だけだね。／言（い）うだけ番長（ばんちょう）。
chinese: 别灰心 (Bié huīxīn) / 振作起来 (Zhènzuò qǐlái)

example:
A: Let's order pizza for lunch.
B: I go along with that.
A: Pepperoni?
B: Always.
A: Done and done.
B: Best decision today.
japanese: 賛成（さんせい）。／それに一票（いっぴょう）。
chinese: 走漏消息 (Zǒulòu xiāoxi) / 说漏嘴 (Shuōlòuzuǐ)

similar: Have a lot on my plate.
example:
A: Can you help me move this couch?
B: Sorry, my hands are full with the baby.
A: Ah, right.
B: Give me ten minutes.
A: No rush.
B: I'll be there soon.
japanese: 手（て）が離（はな）せない。／手（て）一杯（いっぱい）だ。
chinese: 揭老底 (Jiē lǎodǐ) / 把秘密说出来 (Bǎ mìmì shuō chūlái)

example:
A: You're late.
B: I got into a fender bender.
A: Oh no, are you okay?
B: Yeah, just a scratch on the bumper.
A: That's annoying.
B: Tell me about it. Insurance is gonna go up.
japanese: 軽（かる）い接触（せっしょく）事故（じこ）。／コツンとぶつかった。
chinese: 别全信 (Bié quán xìn) / 还是要多留个心眼 (Háishì yào duō liú gè xīnyǎn)

primary: I can’t afford to slack off
similar: 1. I've gotta stay on the grind
4. I need to stay locked in
example:
A: Want to go to that new club tonight?
B: Man, I can’t afford to slack off right now.
A: It’s just one night, you need a break.
B: My finals are next week, I gotta stay on the grind.
A: I get it, you really need to stay locked in.
B: Exactly, I can't fall behind at this stage.
japanese: サボってる余裕（よゆう）はない。／気（き）を抜（ぬ）けない。
chinese: 同甘共苦 (Tónggāngòngkǔ) / 患难与共 (Huànnànyǔgòng)

example:
A: What's the plan for dinner?
B: Let's just play it by ear.
A: I hate uncertainty.
B: Be spontaneous.
A: I need a reservation.
B: Live a little.
japanese: 出（で）たとこ勝負（しょうぶ）でいこう。／流（なが）れに任（まか）せよう。
chinese: 私下里 (Sīxià lǐ) / 暗地里 (Àndì lǐ)

example:
A: You are such a messy eater.
B: Takes one to know one. Look at your shirt.
A: Oops.
B: Exactly.
A: We can't take us anywhere.
B: Nope.
japanese: お互（たが）い様（さま）でしょ。／自分（じぶん）はどうなの。
chinese: 悬而未决 (Xuán'érwèijué) / 还没定死 (Hái méi dìng sǐ)

example:
A: How did you find this restaurant?
B: By word of mouth. It's famous among locals.
A: The food is incredible.
B: Best kept secret in town.
A: Not anymore.
B: Shh, don't tweet it.
japanese: 口（くち）コミで。／人（ひと）づてに。
chinese: 口碑 (Kǒubēi) / 亲口相传 (Qīnkǒu xiāngchuán)

example:
A: Are you okay? You look pale.
B: I feel nauseous. I shouldn't have eaten that sushi.
A: Go to the bathroom.
B: Way ahead of you.
A: Do you need water?
B: I need a bucket.
japanese: 吐（は）き気（け）がする。／気持（きも）ち悪（わる）い。
chinese: 睡觉去 (Shuìjiào qù) / 上床休息 (Shàngchuáng xiūxi)

example:
A: Hurry up! We're almost there.
B: Wait, let me catch my breath.
A: You're so out of shape.
B: I just ran up ten flights of stairs!
A: Excuses.
B: Shut up.
japanese: 息（いき）を整（ととの）える。／一休（ひとやす）みさせて。
chinese: 难得一见 (Nándé yī jiàn) / 太阳从西边出来 (Tàiyáng cóng xībiān chūlái)

example:
A: Why are you limping?
B: Breaking in new shoes. Blisters everywhere.
A: Use bandaids.
B: I ran out.
A: Beauty is pain.
B: Not worth it.
japanese: 靴（くつ）慣（な）らし中（ちゅう）。／新（あたら）しい靴（くつ）だから。
chinese: 身体不适 (Shēntǐ bùshì) / 没精神 (Méi jīngshén)

example:
A: I can't stop thinking about the exam.
B: You need to take your mind off it.
A: How?
B: Let's go watch a movie.
A: Maybe a horror movie?
B: Perfect distraction.
japanese: 気（き）を紛（まぎ）らわせる。／忘（わす）れる。
chinese: 瞎指挥的人 (Xiā zhǐhuī de rén) / 爱管闲事的人 (Ài guǎn xiánshì de rén)

example:
A: Is she mad at you?
B: Yeah, she's giving me the cold shoulder.
A: What did you do?
B: I ate her yogurt.
A: You deserve it.
B: It was expired!
japanese: 冷（つめ）たくあしらう。／無視（むし）する。
chinese: 大嗓门 (Dà sǎngmén) / 叫卖的人 (Jiàomài de rén)

example:
A: I didn't mean to sound rude.
B: None taken. I know you're stressed.
A: Thanks for understanding.
B: We've all been there.
A: You're a saint.
B: I try.
japanese: 気（き）にしてないよ。／悪（わる）く思（おも）ってないよ。
chinese: 迟到总比不到好 (Chídào zǒng bǐ bù dào hǎo) / 亡羊补牢 (Wángyángbǔláo)

example:
A: I bought a drum set.
B: You live in a studio apartment.
A: I should have thought that through.
B: Your neighbors are going to kill you.
A: I'll play softly?
B: Impossible.
japanese: よく考（かんガ）えればよかった。／軽率（けいそつ）だった。
chinese: 物以类聚 (Wùyǐlèijù) / 臭味相投 (Chòuwèixiāngtóu)

similar: 1. Not trying to get in your business
2. I'm not trying to poke around
example:
A: I had a huge fight with my sister today.
B: I'm sorry to hear that. I don’t want to pry, but...
A: It's okay, I just need to vent a little.
B: Not trying to get in your business, but is she okay?
A: She’s just being difficult as usual.
B: Understood, I'll stay out of it then.
japanese: 詮索（せんさく）したくないけど。／根掘（ねほ）り葉掘（はほ）り聞（き）きたくないけど。
chinese: 挑灯夜读 (Tiǎodēngyèdú) / 熬夜加班 (Áoyè jiābān)

similar: Trick someone into doing your work.
example:
A: Did you just make me clean your entire room?
B: You said you liked organizing!
A: You totally pulled a Tom Sawyer on me.
B: Hey, it looks great though.
A: You owe me dinner.
B: Deal.
japanese: うまく乗（の）せられた。／人（ひと）に使（つか）い道（みち）を教（おし）えられた。
chinese: 险些 (Xiǎnxiē) / 侥幸 (Jiǎoxìng)

example:
A: Should I apply for that job?
B: Do it. Nothing to lose.
A: But I'm underqualified.
B: Let them decide that.
A: Okay, applying.
B: Good attitude.
japanese: 失（うし）なうものは何（なに）もない。／ダメ元（もと）で。
chinese: 人不可貌相 (Rén bùkě mào xiàng) / 别狗眼看人低 (Bié gǒu yǎn kàn rén dī)

primary: Eyes are bigger than your stomach
similar: Bit off more than you can chew.
example:
A: I can't finish this steak.
B: Your eyes were bigger than your stomach.
A: It looked smaller on the menu.
B: Doggy bag?
A: Please.
B: I warned you.
japanese: 目（め）で食（た）べてる。／取（と）りすぎだよ。
chinese: 我得走了 (Wǒ děi zǒu le) / 我该告辞了 (Wǒ gāi gàocí le)

similar: Put your money where your mouth is.
example:
A: I'm going to run a marathon next year.
B: Talk is cheap. Start training.
A: I bought the shoes.
B: That's the easy part.
A: Watch me.
B: I'm watching.
japanese: 言（い）うのは簡単（かんたん）。／口（くち）ではなんとでも言（い）える。
chinese: 你不能就这么走了 (Nǐ bùnéng jiù zhème zǒu le) / 别急着走啊 (Bié jízhe zǒu a)

example:
A: He's smart, funny, and rich.
B: He's the whole package.
A: And he cooks.
B: Marry him.
A: We just met.
B: Did I stutter?
japanese: パーフェクトだ。／全（すべ）てを持（も）ってる。
chinese: 好好想想吧 (Hǎohǎo xiǎngxiǎng ba) / 考虑清楚 (Kǎolǜ qīngchu)

example:
A: I don't know which one to pick.
B: Follow your gut.
A: My gut says 'both'.
B: Your gut is greedy.
A: It's wise.
B: It's expensive.
japanese: 直感（ちょっかん）に従（したが）って。／ピンときた方（ほう）で。
chinese: 我哪儿知道啊 (Wǒ nǎr zhīdào a) / 没想到 (Méi xiǎngdào)

example:
A: He just smiled at me.
B: And?
A: My heart is fluttering!
B: You are obsessed.
A: He's so cute.
B: Go talk to him.
japanese: ドキドキしてる。／胸（むね）が高鳴（たかな）ってる。
chinese: 片尾彩蛋 (Piànwěi cǎidàn) / 花絮 (Huāxù)

example:
A: Do you still love him?
B: My feelings have faded.
A: That happens.
B: We're just friends now.
A: Better than enemies.
B: True.
japanese: 気持（きも）ちが冷（さ）める。／熱（ねつ）が冷（さ）める。
chinese: 完好无损 (Wánhǎowúsǔn) / 原封不动 (Yuánfēngbùdòng)

example:
A: Remember when you tripped on stage?
B: Stop rubbing it in!
A: It was so funny.
B: It was traumatic.
A: Viral moment.
B: I hate you.
japanese: しつこいよ。／もう言（い）わなくていいよ。
chinese: 太突然了 (Tài tūrán le) / 莫名其妙 (Mòmíngqímiào)

example:
A: He failed school but is now a billionaire.
B: It just goes to show that grades aren't everything.
A: Or he got lucky.
B: Hard work counts too.
A: Sure.
B: Don't drop out though.
japanese: それが証拠（しょうこ）だよ。／よくわかるでしょ。
chinese: 新婚夫妇 (Xīnhūn fūfù) / 刚结婚的小两口 (Gāng jiéhūn de xiǎoliǎngkǒu)

example:
A: I don't think I can finish this marathon.
B: Come on, you're almost there! Mind over matter.
A: My legs feel like lead right now.
B: Just focus on the mindset and keep moving.
A: I guess I just have to power through it.
B: That’s the spirit! Willpower is everything.
japanese: 気（き）の持（も）ちよう。／精神（せいしん）力（りょく）だよ。
chinese: 左翼 (Zuǒyì) / 激进派 (Jījìnpài)

meaning: 아이디어 좀 공유하고 싶어. 의견 좀 줘.
example:
A: Hey, can I bounce some ideas off you?
B: Sure, what are you working on?
A: Just a new marketing pitch.
B: Lay it on me.
A: So, imagine this...
B: I'm listening.
japanese: アイデアを聞（き）いてほしい。／壁打（かべう）ちさせて。
chinese: 严格来说 (Yángé lái shuō) / 技术层面上说 (Jìshù céngmiàn shàng shuō)

example:
A: Why do you like this club so much?
B: It gives me a sense of belonging.
A: Like a second family?
B: Exactly. Everyone gets me here.
A: That's really special.
B: You should join too.
japanese: 居場所（いばしょ）。／所属（しょぞく）感（かん）。
chinese: 我真不想承认 (Wǒ zhēn bù xiǎng chéngrèn) / 虽说我不愿意承认 (Suīshuō wǒ bù yuànyì chéngrèn)

meaning: 나를 위한 사치. 호강 좀 하다.
example:
A: You look relaxed.
B: I decided to pamper myself today.
A: Spa day?
B: Massage, facial, the works.
A: I'm jealous.
B: You should come next time.
japanese: 自分（じぶん）へのご褒美（ほうび）。／贅沢（ぜいたく）する。
chinese: 归属感 (Guīshǔgǎn) / 认同感 (Rèntónggǎn)

example:
A: Are we getting dessert?
B: I'm going to indulge myself tonight.
A: Chocolate cake?
B: And ice cream. Don't judge.
A: I support this decision.
B: Diet starts tomorrow.
japanese: 思（おも）う存分（ぞんぶん）楽（たの）しむ。／好（す）きなことする。
chinese: 我不比任何人差 (Wǒ bù bǐ rènhé rén chà) / 我是最好的 (Wǒ shì zuì hǎo de)

example:
A: What do you think of this apartment?
B: Honestly? It's too shabby.
A: The rent is cheap though.
B: There's a reason for that.
A: I can fix it up.
B: You're brave.
japanese: ボロすぎ。／みすぼらしい。
chinese: 别对自己太苛刻 (Bié duì zìjǐ tài kēkè) / 别难为自己 (Bié nánwéi zìjǐ)

example:
A: I finished the marathon in 4 hours.
B: Not too shabby for your first time.
A: My legs are killing me though.
B: You should be proud.
A: Beer me.
B: Coming right up.
japanese: 悪（わる）くないね。／なかなかイケる。
chinese: 世界真小 (Shìjiè zhēn xiǎo) / 冤家路窄 (Yuānjiālùzhǎi)

example:
A: Can I say something?
B: Go ahead.
A: It sounds corny, but you complete me.
B: Aww, that is corny. But I love it.
A: I mean it.
B: I know you do.
japanese: キザに聞（き）こえるかもだけど。／ベタだけど。
chinese: 别低头 (Bié dītóu) / 挺起胸膛 (Tǐng qǐ xiōngtáng)

example:
A: Any advice for the test?
B: It might sound obvious, but get good sleep.
A: I was planning to pull an all-nighter.
B: Don't. Your brain needs rest.
A: You're probably right.
B: Trust me on this.
japanese: 当（あ）たり前（まえ）に聞（き）こえるかもだけど。／言（い）わずもがなだけど。
chinese: 不劳无获 (Bùláowúhuò) / 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人 (Chī de kǔ zhōng kǔ, fāng wéi rén shàng rén)

example:
A: You need to stop eating junk food.
B: Look who's talking! You're eating a burger.
A: This is a protein burger.
B: Whatever helps you sleep at night.
A: Shut up and pass the fries.
B: Hypocrite.
japanese: どの口（くち）が言（い）う。／お前（まえ）が言（い）うな。
chinese: 突然地 (Tūrán de) / 冷不丁 (Lěngbùdīng)

example:
A: Do you have a minute to chat?
B: I'm a little pressed for time right now.
A: It's urgent.
B: Okay, walk with me.
A: I'll be quick.
B: Shoot.
japanese: 時間（じかん）がないんだ。／急（いそ）いでる。
chinese: 换位思考一下 (Huànwèi sīkǎo yīxià) / 设身处地地想想 (Shèshēnchǔdì de xiǎngxiǎng)

example:
A: Do you think they'll find out about the mistake?
B: Honestly, it's just a matter of time.
A: Maybe we can fix it before they notice.
B: It’s bound to happen, the audit starts tomorrow.
A: I guess it’s inevitable then.
B: Yeah, it’s just a waiting game now.
japanese: 時間（じかん）の問題（もんだい）だ。／そのうちそうなる。
chinese: 看法一致 (Kànfǎ yīzhì) / 见解相同 (Jiànjiě xiāngtóng)

example:
A: I haven't started the essay yet.
B: Dude, the clock is ticking.
A: I work better under pressure.
B: You're gonna regret this.
A: I'll be fine.
B: Don't call me when you're crying.
japanese: 時間（じかん）が迫（せま）ってる。／チクタクいってるよ。
chinese: 注意安全 (Zhùyì ānquán) / 保重 (Bǎozhòng)

example:
A: How do I get to the airport fast?
B: Your best bet is the express train.
A: Is a taxi faster?
B: Not with this traffic.
A: Train it is then.
B: Safe travels.
japanese: それが一番（いちばん）確実（かくじつ）だ。／ベストな選択（せんたく）だ。
chinese: 想当然 (Xiǎngdāngrán) / 视而不见 (Shì'érbùjiàn)

meaning: 오늘 컨디션이 별로야. 내가 아닌 것 같아.
example:
A: You seem quiet today.
B: Yeah, I'm not myself today.
A: Is everything okay?
B: Just tired and headachey.
A: Go home and rest.
B: I wish I could.
japanese: いつもの自分（じぶん）じゃない。／調子（ちょうし）狂（くる）う。
chinese: 两全其美 (Liǎngquánqíměi) / 一举两得 (Yījǔliǎngdé)

example:
A: I can't stop crying about him.
B: Girl, get it together. He's trash.
A: But I miss him.
B: You're better than this.
A: I know, I know.
B: Let's go dance it off.
japanese: しっかりして。／シャンとしろ。
chinese: 简而言之 (Jiǎn'éryánzhī) / 说来话长 (Shuōláihuàcháng)

example:
A: I'm going to become a billionaire by next year.
B: You need to come back down to earth.
A: You just don't believe in me.
B: I believe in math, and yours doesn't add up.
A: Watch me.
B: I'll be watching.
japanese: 現実（げんじつ）を見（み）て。／夢（ゆめ）から覚（さ）めて。
chinese: 绝无可能 (Jué wú kěnéng) / 下辈子吧 (Xiàbèizi ba)

example:
A: Want to grab a drink?
B: Can't. Deadlines are looming.
A: Just one drink.
B: I wish. I have to work late.
A: Good luck.
B: Pray for me.
japanese: 締（し）め切（き）りが迫（せま）ってる。／ヤバい。
chinese: 弄明白 (Nòng míngbai) / 理解 (Lǐjiě)

meaning: 정신없이 바빠. 여러 가지 일을 동시에 하고 있어.
example:
A: How's the new role?
B: Intense. I'm juggling a lot right now.
A: Don't burn out.
B: Trying not to. Coffee helps.
A: Take breaks.
B: I'll try.
japanese: いろいろ抱（かか）え込（こ）んでる。／てんてこ舞（まい）だ。
chinese: 你说得太对了 (Nǐ shuō de tài duì le) / 我完全同意 (Wǒ wánquán tóngyì)

example:
A: Are you outdoorsy?
B: Not really. I prefer AC.
A: Oh, I was going to invite you camping.
B: Hard pass. Bugs and I don't mix.
A: Hotel it is then.
B: Now you're speaking my language.
japanese: アウトドア派（は）。／外（そと）が好（す）き。
chinese: 我也不知道 (Wǒ yě bù zhīdào) / 谁说得准呢 (Shéi shuō de zhǔn ne)

meaning: 내 말 무슨 뜻인지 알지? (눈치 줌)
similar: Pick up what I'm putting down?
example:
A: He's nice, but... you know.
B: I catch your drift.
A: Yeah, not explicitly saying it.
B: Loud and clear.
A: Good.
B: Say no more.
japanese: 言（い）いたいことわかる？／察（さっ）して。
chinese: 在我看来 (Zài wǒ kànlái) / 就我而言 (Jiù wǒ éryán)

example:
A: Can you come out Saturday?
B: Can't, I have a family function.
A: Boring?
B: It's my grandma's 90th, so mandatory.
A: Have fun.
B: I'll try to sneak out early.
japanese: 親戚（しんせき）の集（あつまり）。／家族（かぞく）行事（ぎょうじ）。
chinese: 稳妥起见 (Wěntuǒ qǐjiàn) / 宁可信其有 (Nìngkě xìn qí yǒu)

meaning: 옆으로 좀 비켜봐 / 자리 좀 만들어줘
example:
A: The subway is so packed today.
B: Hey, can you scoot over a little?
A: Sorry, let me make some space for you.
B: Thanks, if you could just shift a bit to the left.
A: Is this enough? I’m trying to slide over.
B: Perfect, thanks for giving me some room.
japanese: 詰（つ）めて。／席（せき）空（あ）けて。
chinese: 别让我失望 (Bié ràng wǒ shīwàng) / 靠你了 (Kào nǐ le)

example:
A: I'm freaking out about the wedding.
B: You need to keep it together.
A: So much to do.
B: One thing at a time. Breathe.
A: You're right.
B: You got this, bridezilla.
japanese: 落（お）ち着（つ）いて。／取（と）り乱（みだ）さないで。
chinese: 祈祷好运 (Qǐdǎo hǎoyùn) / 菩萨保佑 (Púsà bǎoyòu)

example:
A: He was screaming in my face.
B: Did you yell back?
A: No, I managed to keep my cool.
B: Proud of you. That takes patience.
A: I was shaking though.
B: But you handled it like a pro.
japanese: 冷静（れいせい）さを保（たも）つ。／キレない。
chinese: 念在旧情 (Niàn zài jiùqíng) / 看在往日的份上 (Kàn zài wǎngrì de fèn shàng)

example:
A: Step outside yet?
B: No, why?
A: It's beautiful out. You need fresh air.
B: Maybe I'll take a walk.
A: Do it. It's wasted inside.
B: grabbing my shoes now.
japanese: 外（そと）は天気（てんき）いいよ。／最高（さいこう）の天気（てんき）だ。
chinese: 掌握窍门 (Zhǎngwò qiàomén) / 上手了 (Shàngshǒu le)

example:
A: She was totally checking me out.
B: Don't flatter yourself. She was looking at the menu.
A: No, we made eye contact.
B: In your dreams.
A: I have aura.
B: You have delusions.
japanese: 自惚（うぬぼ）れないで。／勘違（かんちが）いしないで。
chinese: 怎么会? (Zěnme huì?) / 什么意思? (Shénme yìsi?)

meaning: 그만 좀 괴롭혀. 귀찮게 하지 마.
example:
A: Are we there yet? Are we there yet?
B: Stop pestering me! We'll be there soon.
A: I'm bored.
B: Read a book or sleep.
A: Ugh, fine.
B: Silence is golden.
japanese: せかさないで。／まとわりつかないで。
chinese: 我也没办法 (Wǒ yě méibànfǎ) / 我忍不住 (Wǒ rěnbùzhù)

example:
A: Can I finish these fries?
B: Knock yourself out. I'm full.
A: Yes! I hate wasting food.
B: You are a human vacuum.
A: It's a talent.
B: Sure it is.
japanese: 好（す）きにやって。／遠慮（えんりょ）なくどうぞ。
chinese: 要是...就好了 (Yàoshi... jiù hǎole) / 但愿 (Dànyuàn)

example:
A: I promised them a discount.
B: What? Without asking me?
A: I meant to run it by you first.
B: Next time, ask before you promise.
A: My bad.
B: It's fine, just communicate.
japanese: 確認（かくにん）しておきたい。／一応（いちおう）耳（みみ）に入（い）れておく。
chinese: 无论如何 (Wúlùn rúhé) / 不管怎样 (Bùguǎn zěnyàng)

example:
A: What are you doing?
B: Just drafting an email to the client.
A: Make sure to sound professional.
B: I'm trying. It's tricky.
A: Let me proofread it.
B: Thanks, I need fresh eyes.
japanese: 下書（したが）き中（ちゅう）。／構成（こうせい）中（ちゅう）。
chinese: 由你决定 (Yóu nǐ juédìng) / 你看着办吧 (Nǐ kànzhe bàn ba)

similar: Six of one, half dozen of the other.
example:
A: It's technically cyan, not blue.
B: Same difference. It's blue.
A: Artists care about that stuff.
B: I'm colorblind to nuance.
A: Clearly.
B: Don't roast me.
japanese: 似（に）たり寄（よ）ったり。／五十歩（ごじゅっぽ）百歩（ひゃっぽ）。
chinese: 以防万一 (Yǐfángwànyī) / 有备无患 (Yǒubèiwúhuàn)

example:
A: I'm going to scream.
B: Don't make a scene. We're in a library.
A: I'm so mad though.
B: Scream inside your heart.
A: Ughhhh.
B: Good job.
japanese: 騒（さわ）ぎ立（た）てないで。／人前（ひとまえ）で恥（は）ずかしいことしないで。
chinese: 警惕点儿 (Jǐngtì diǎnr) / 睁大眼睛找 (Zhēng dà yǎnjing zhǎo)

primary: Don’t take it out on me
similar: 3. Not my fault, don't blame me
4. Don't catch an attitude with me
example:
A: Why is this coffee taking so long?!
B: Hey, don’t take it out on me, I just got here.
A: I'm just so stressed about this meeting.
B: I get it, but I'm not your punching bag.
A: You're right, I'm sorry for venting at you.
B: Thanks, just try to keep your cool with me.
japanese: 八（や）つ当（あ）たりしないで。／私（わたし）に当（あ）たらないで。
chinese: 简略地说 (Jiǎnlüè de shuō) / 缩短话题 (Suōduǎn huàtí)

example:
A: Is he still mad about the sandwich?
B: Yeah, he's being so petty.
A: It was three years ago.
B: He never forgets.
A: That's exhausting.
B: Tell me about it.
japanese: 心（こころ）が狭（せま）い。／ネチネチしてる。
chinese: 差得远呢 (Chà de yuǎn ne) / 远不如 (Yuǎn bùrú)

similar: Light at the end of the tunnel.
example:
A: I've had such a bad month.
B: Hang in there. Good things are coming.
A: I hope you're right.
B: I promise. The universe balances out.
A: Thanks for the positivity.
B: Always.
japanese: いいことあるよ。／これからだよ。
chinese: 凭直觉想到的 (Píng zhíjué xiǎngdào de) / 随口一说 (Suíkǒu yī shuō)

example:
A: I just closed another deal.
B: Wow, you're killing it lately!
A: I'm trying to get that promotion.
B: Ideally, it's already yours.
A: Fingers crossed.
B: You don't need luck.
japanese: 絶好調（ぜっこうちょう）だね。／神（かみ）がかってる。
chinese: 你干得漂亮 (Nǐ gàn de piàoliang) / 你表现得太棒了 (Nǐ biǎoxiàn de tài bàng le)

example:
A: How was my presentation?
B: You crushed it! Everyone was impressed.
A: I was so nervous.
B: Couldn't tell at all.
A: Phew.
B: Drinks on you tonight.
japanese: 最高（さいこう）だったよ。／圧倒（あっとう）したね。
chinese: 你赢了 (Nǐ yíng le) / 你做得太出色了 (Nǐ zuò de tài chūsè le)

example:
A: Have you seen the new sci-fi movie?
B: Yes, the visual effects were mind-blowing.
A: Better than the first one?
B: Way better. It blew my mind.
A: I need to buy tickets.
B: Go IMAX or go home.
japanese: 度肝（どぎも）を抜（ぬ）く。／衝撃（しょうげき）的（てき）。
chinese: 令人大开眼界 (Lìng rén dà kāi yǎnjié) / 极其震撼 (Jíqí zhènhàn)

example:
A: He borrowed money from you again?
B: Yeah, he said he'd pay me back.
A: Stop being such a doormat.
B: I just want to help.
A: He's using you.
B: I know...
japanese: 言（い）いなり。／敷物（しきもの）扱（あつか）い。
chinese: 软柿子 (Ruǎnshìzi) / 受气包 (Shòuqìbāo)

example:
A: I'm quitting tomorrow.
B: Whoa, you caught me off guard.
A: I've been planning it for months.
B: You hid it well.
A: Didn't want drama.
B: Well, mission accomplished.
japanese: 不意（ふい）を突（つ）かれた。／びっくりした。
chinese: 让我措手不及 (Ràng wǒ cuòshǒubùjí) / 出乎我的意料 (Chū hū wǒ de yìliào)

example:
A: Who was that?
B: My ex-wife.
A: Oh, awkward?
B: We're cool now.
A: That's mature.
B: It took ten years.
japanese: 元（もと）奥（おく）さん。／別（わか）れた妻（つま）。
chinese: 前妻 (Qiánqī) / 前任太太 (Qiánrèn tàitai)

primary: I still have a long way to go
example:
A: Your Korean is amazing.
B: Thanks, but I still have a long way to go.
A: You're too modest.
B: Seriously, verbs are hard.
A: You'll get there.
B: Fighting!
japanese: まだまだだよ。／修行（しゅぎょう）が足（た）りない。
chinese: 我还差得远呢 (Wǒ hái chà de yuǎn ne) / 还有很长的路要走 (Háiyǒu hěn cháng de lù yào zǒu)

example:
A: Are we almost finished?
B: Nope, long way to go.
A: I'm tired.
B: Pace yourself.
A: Can we take a break?
B: Five minutes only.
japanese: 先（さき）は長（なが）い。／まだまだこれから。
chinese: 路还长着呢 (Lù hái zháng zhe ne) / 远没结束 (Yuǎn méi jiéshù)

meaning: 네가 하는 말 좀 들어봐, 정말 너무하네
example:
A: I think I should quit my job and move to Mars.
B: Wow, listen to yourself right now.
A: Why? I’m serious about the space program.
B: This is outrageous, you don't even like flying!
A: I can learn to love it for the mission.
B: Seriously, you're tripping if you think that'll work.
japanese: 何（なに）言（い）ってるの？／自分（じぶん）の言（い）ってることわかってる？
chinese: 听听你在说什么 (Tīngting nǐ zài shuō shénme) / 你也太可笑了 (Nǐ yě tài kěxiào le)

example:
A: I crashed my dad's car.
B: You have to face the music.
A: He's going to kill me.
B: Better to tell him now than later.
A: Come with me?
B: No chance.
japanese: 潔（いさぎよ）く認（みと）める。／年貢（ねんぐ）の納（おさ）め時（どき）だ。
chinese: 勇敢面对后果 (Yǒnggǎn miànduì hòuguǒ) / 听天由命 (Tīngtiānyóumìng)

example:
A: Did you see what she wore?
B: I can't even.
A: It was a choice.
B: I literally have no words.
A: Same.
B: Moving on.
japanese: もう無理（むり）。／言葉（ことば）も出（で）ない（呆（あき）れ）。
chinese: 我真无语 (Wǒ zhēn wúyǔ) / 我都不知道该说什么好了 (Wǒ dōu bù zhīdào gāi shuō shénme hǎo le)

example:
A: Why are you so sad lately?
B: Just autumn blues, I guess.
A: The weather is getting colder.
B: Yeah, I miss summer.
A: Let's get pumpkin spice lattes.
B: That actually helps.
japanese: 秋（あき）の憂鬱（ゆううつ）。／センチメンタルな気分（きぶん）。
chinese: 秋愁 (Qiū chóu) / 悲秋感怀 (Bēiqiū gǎnhuái)

similar: Fake it till you make it.
example:
A: He's definitely staring at me.
B: He's looking at the clock.
A: Delulu is the solulu.
B: Whatever makes you happy.
A: We're practically married.
B: Okay, crazy.
japanese: 勘違（かんちが）いしたもん勝（が）ち。／思（おも）い込（こ）みが大事（だいじ）。
chinese: 异想天开也就是办法 (Yìxiǎngtiānkāi yě jiùshì bànfǎ) / 幻想就是出路 (Huànxiǎng jiùshì chūlù)

example:
A: The final exam is going to be brutal.
B: Bring it on. I studied all week.
A: Confident much?
B: Prepared much.
A: Good luck.
B: You too.
japanese: かかってこい！／やってやるよ！
chinese: 尽管放马过来吧 (Jǐnguǎn fàngmǎ guòlái ba) / 来吧 (Lái ba)

meaning: 말도 안 돼. 절대 안 돼.
example:
A: Can I borrow the car for a road trip?
B: Out of the question.
A: Why?
B: You don't have a license.
A: Details.
B: Important details.
japanese: 論外（ろんがい）だ。／あり得（え）ない。
chinese: 绝无可能 (Jué wú kěnéng) / 门儿都没有 (Ménr dōu méiyǒu)

example:
A: I argued with a stranger online for 4 hours.
B: You need to touch grass.
A: But he was wrong!
B: It doesn't matter. Go for a walk.
A: Fine.
B: Leave the phone.
japanese: 現実（げんじつ）を見（み）ろ。／外（そと）の空気（くうき）吸（す）ってこい。
chinese: 去亲近下大自然吧 (Qù qīnjìn xià dàzìrán ba) / 清醒一点儿 (Qīngxǐng yīdiǎnr)

example:
A: I have no idea what I'm doing.
B: Just fake it 'til you make it.
A: What if they find out?
B: They won't. Everyone is faking it.
A: Comforting?
B: Revealing.
japanese: ハッタリかませ。／できるフリしてればなんとかなる。
chinese: 装假直到成真 (Zhuāngjiǎ zhídào chéng zhēn) / 演也要演到底 (Yǎn yě yào yǎn dàodǐ)

example:
A: What are you doing?
B: Just sipping on some coffee. You?
A: Working hard.
B: Join me.
A: I wish.
B: I'll save you a cup.
japanese: コーヒーをちびちび飲（の）んでる。／コーヒーブレイク中（ちゅう）。
chinese: 啜饮咖啡 (Chuò yǐn kāfēi) / 喝着咖啡 (Hēzhe kāfēi)
